full_threads.body:
No worries at all! I just sent you a phonebook of information, as I thought it'd be an email, sorry. :(

--

https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/1421385/square_128/james-1504064721.jpg?1504064721 James from Kinsta

On Mon, May 7, 2018 at 02:13 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi James, sorry I had to run out for a bit

On Mon, May 7, 2018 at 02:13 PM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi there,

Thanks for your patience - just an update on this.

I've managed to find *one* possible backdoor, that's been on the site since when I think the site was migrated to Kinsta (February of this year sound right?).

I can't see anything there that's still generating the content that's linked on Google though. I've tried setting my referer to GoogleBot's to grab the page, and it all returns only your HTML... what I'm suspecting is going on is that an older theme was backdoored, and is now gone, and Google hasn't deindexed the pages yet (I'm not sure how that works, I'm not exactly an expert in SEO).

If you can get the "fetch as GoogleBot" feature to work and find the nonsense content they have on those pages, please let us know... but if there's illegitimate content on that theme it's pretty well hidden.

Are you able to get clean copies of the nextgen-gallery, simple-newsletter-signup and woocommerce plugins, and reinstall them over the top of what's there? Quite a few of the files aren't validating, and many of the plugins won't validate at all as we don't have checksums for them.

There are also some plugins that need updating, and if you can also verify that all these users are supposed to have admin privileges:

+----+------------+-----------------+------------------------+---------------------+---------------+
| ID | user_login | display_name | user_email | user_registered | roles |
+----+------------+-----------------+------------------------+---------------------+---------------+
| 9 | Joao | Joao | joao@wpperk.com | 2018-03-08 01:19:45 | administrator |
| 8 | joel | Joel Maligalig | joel@wolfiq.com.au | 2018-02-06 08:00:10 | administrator |
| 2 | n1cksadm1n | n1cksadm1n | john@eyedentity.com.au | 2014-11-20 11:07:22 | administrator |
| 3 | natasha1 | natasha1 | john@orderup.com.au | 2014-11-20 11:39:31 | administrator |
| 7 | team | WP Perk Support | support@wpperk.com | 2018-02-05 04:37:15 | administrator |
+----+------------+-----------------+------------------------+---------------------+---------------+

If there are no actual backdoors on the site still, what I'd suggest we do is set up an Nginx rule so that anything with ?exam= in the URL 404s so that Google removes those pages from it's index rather quickly.

On Mon, May 7, 2018 at 12:29 PM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Do you have access to the Google Webmaster Tools for that site?

On Mon, May 7, 2018 at 12:17 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

The ones that have /?exam= after the root URL

On Mon, May 7, 2018 at 12:17 PM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I'll check this out for you right now.

On Mon, May 7, 2018 at 12:16 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

The site on install 'nicks' seems like it may have been hacked.

If you google site:www.nicks-seafood.com.au you can see some links to pages on the site that don't actually exist.

On Mon, May 7, 2018 at 12:15 PM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi there!

On Mon, May 7, 2018 at 12:15 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Guys.

The site on install
